content.description:
Following the North End wall to its end rewards you with a few very nice boulder problems. There are a number of basalt-like columns which have fallen off the cliff and form some beautiful dihedrals and cracks. The smooth faces of some of these columns is covered in a smooth brick-red varnish, which looks almost like somone slapped a layer of paint on the wall. 

  There is one column which is a bit longer and shows evidence of climbing; old pin scars.
